head.supplied: FORM OF RECOMMENDATION ¶ FOR A FELLOW OF THE LINNEAN SOCIETY OF LONDON. ¶ Fred. Harry Baker Esqr F.R.M.S, Dentist, 100 ¶ Bridge Road, Richmond, near Melbourne. ¶ a gentleman attached to the study of ...

div.p: To the Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society, London, Certificates of Fellows, Foreign Members and Associates, 1891-97.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: M autograph manuscript and signature; other supporters’ individual signatures. To have been read in March 1893, the certificate would need to have been mailed by January; it is numbered accordingly.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;
p.seg: FOR A FELLOW OF THE LINNEAN SOCIETY OF LONDON.

div.p:
Fred. Harry Baker Esqr F.R.M.S, Dentist, 100
100 has been inserted, but it is not clear in whose hand.
Bridge Road, Richmond, near Melbourne.

a gentleman attached to the study of Natural History, especially to researches
on new medical plants

seg.seg: being desirous of becoming a Fellow of the LINNEAN SOCIETY OF LONDON, we, whose names are underwritten, beg leave to recommend him to that honour.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: -0.0445in; text-indent: -0.3717in;

div.p: Baron Von Mueller FLS (from personal knowledge)

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: -0.0445in; text-indent: -0.3717in;

div.p: Geo. S. Perrin F.L.S. Personal knowledge

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: -0.0445in; text-indent: -0.3717in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;

seg.seg: This recommendation must be signed by Three or more Fellows.

p.seg: N.B. – The Christian name of the Candidate must be stated at length, as well as his Residence, and any special qualifications he may possess.

div.p: This certificate was read at a General Meeting of the Society, on the 2 day of March 1893

The Ballot will take place on the 6th day of April 1893
Annotated back: Frederick Harry Baker elected 6 April 1893.
